examples.sentence: Sustainable fashion is a growing movement aimed at reducing the negative impact of the fashion industry on the environment.
Many designers are now incorporating sustainable fashion practices into their designs, such as using recycled materials and eco-friendly production methods.
Sustainable fashion is not just about being environmentally conscious, it also includes fair labor practices and ethical treatment of workers.
Ethical fashion focuses more on the social aspects of production, while sustainable fashion emphasizes the environmental impact.
Many fashion brands are now embracing ethical fashion practices to reduce their impact on the environment and promote fair labor practices.
By supporting ethical fashion, consumers can make a positive impact on the fashion industry and contribute to a more sustainable future.
Fast fashion is a business model that prioritizes cheap, trendy clothing produced quickly and at a large scale.
The cycle of fast fashion encourages consumers to constantly buy new clothes and discard old ones, leading to a culture of waste.
Many fast fashion brands rely on unethical labor practices and contribute to environmental degradation.
Slow fashion focuses on reducing waste and creating long-lasting products, while sustainable fashion focuses on reducing the environmental impact of the fashion industry as a whole.
I prefer to invest in slow fashion pieces that I know will last for years, rather than constantly buying cheap, fast fashion items.
By choosing to support slow fashion brands, you can help to create a more sustainable and ethical fashion industry.
Circular fashion focuses on extending the lifespan of clothes and materials by creating a system where waste is minimized and resources are continuously reused or recycled.
By embracing circular fashion, we can reduce the environmental impact of the fashion industry.
Brands that adopt circular fashion principles aim to close the loop on the production and consumption of clothing.
The fashion industry has the potential to greatly reduce its environmental impact by transitioning to renewable energy sources.
Some fashion brands are incorporating renewable materials like organic cotton and bamboo in their products to reduce their carbon footprint.
The production of renewable materials such as tencel and hemp requires less water and resources, making them a great choice for sustainable fashion.

translations.meaning: không thử nghiệm trên động vật

examples.sentence: Cruelty-free fashion can protect animal rights and welfare, and reduce the environmental impact of animal agriculture.
This brand of shoes is known for its cruelty-free production process, using only vegan materials.
The company's commitment to using only cruelty-free ingredients has earned it a loyal following among animal rights activists.

translations.meaning: có nguồn gốc từ động vật

examples.sentence: The production of animal-derived materials like fur and exotic skins has a negative impact on animal welfare and the environment.
The use of animal-derived materials in the fashion industry has been linked to environmental concerns, such as deforestation, water pollution, and greenhouse gas emissions.
As consumers become more conscious about the impact of their fashion choices, many are seeking out cruelty-free and animal-derived free options.
The sustainable fashion brand prides itself on being transparent about their production process, from sourcing materials to manufacturing and delivery.
A key element of sustainable fashion is transparency, as it allows customers to make informed choices about the products they buy.
Through transparency, fashion brands can build trust with consumers and establish themselves as ethical and responsible businesses.
It's important to research a company's claims to avoid falling for greenwashing campaigns and to make informed purchasing decisions.
Brands that engage in greenwashing may use sustainable materials for their products but overlook other aspects, such as labor and transportation.
The rise of greenwashing in the fashion industry has led to increased demand for transparency from consumers.
The concept of durability is closely linked to slow fashion, as it promotes creating long-lasting clothing pieces rather than fast and disposable ones.
Brands that prioritize durability in their products tend to produce timeless products that can last for years.
Durability is not only important for reducing waste but also for reducing the environmental impact of the fashion industry.

translations.meaning: có khả năng phân huỷ sinh học

examples.sentence: This dress is made from biodegradable materials, so you can feel good about wearing it without harming the environment.
We ensure that all of our products are made from biodegradable materials and follow strict ethical standards to promote sustainability.
The biodegradable fabric of this shirt will decompose naturally and quickly, minimizing its environmental impact.
The carbon footprint of the fashion industry is enormous, accounting for a significant portion of global greenhouse gas emissions.
By choosing to produce locally, fashion brands can significantly reduce their carbon footprint and support local communities.
Fashion brands can calculate their carbon footprint to measure the environmental impact of their operations and take steps to reduce it.
Choosing clothing made from natural fibers instead of synthetic fabrics can help reduce the amount of microplastics released into the environment.
Microplastics can be harmful to both wildlife and human life.
Washing clothing in a special bag designed to capture microplastics can also help reduce the microplastics pollution.
Synthetic fibers are often made from non-renewable resources and have a significant environmental impact.
Synthetic materials can take hundreds of years to break down in landfills, contributing to environmental problems.
The use of synthetic materials in clothing can also have negative effects on our health, as they may contain harmful chemicals and microplastics.
This dress is made from linen, a natural and eco-friendly material that is perfect for summer.
Many sustainable fashion brands are now using linen as a more sustainable alternative to cotton.
Linen is a durable and long-lasting material, making it a great option for sustainable fashion.
Many sustainable fashion brands are turning to innovative plant-based fibers like bamboo, hemp, and soy to reduce their environmental impact.
The choice of fiber used in clothing plays a significant role in reducing carbon emissions.
Sustainable fashion companies are prioritizing the use of organic and biodegradable fibers to minimize harm to the environment.
Silk production is a labor-intensive process, which is why it tends to be more expensive than other fabrics.
Silk is a natural and biodegradable fiber that is often favored by sustainable fashion designers for its luxurious feel and durability.
The production of conventional silk can involve harmful chemicals and water pollution.
A key aspect of sustainable fashion is reducing the amount of leather used in clothing and accessories.
Some sustainable fashion companies use recycled leather to reduce waste and environmental impact.
Sustainable fashion is about more than just the materials used, but also the ethical treatment of animals and people involved in the production process of leather.
The production of animal fur often involves cruel practices that are not sustainable or ethical.
Sustainable fashion is all about making conscious choices, including choosing to avoid clothing items made with real fur.
Choosing not to buy fur products is a small but impactful way to support sustainable fashion.
Many sustainable fashion brands are moving away from using polyester, as it is a synthetic fiber that is made from nonrenewable resources.
Polyester is often used in fast fashion because it is cheap and easy to produce, but it produces microplastics when washed, contributing to ocean pollution.
Some sustainable fashion brands are using polyester made from plant-based materials, which is biodegradable and causes no harm to the environment.
Many sustainable fashion brands avoid using nylon in their products because it is a synthetic fiber that is not biodegradable.
Some sustainable fashion brands are experimenting with upcycling nylon waste into new products, such as swimwear and activewear.
Nylon is often used in fast fashion because it is inexpensive to produce, but it has a high environmental impact.

translations.meaning: văn hóa dùng và vứt nhanh chóng

examples.sentence: The problem with disposable culture is that it generates excessive waste and harms the environment.
The fast fashion industry has contributed to the growth of a disposable culture, where people throw the clothes away after a few wears.
Disposable culture is not only bad for the environment but also for the workers in the fast fashion industry who are often underpaid and overworked.
Versatile clothes are essential in building a sustainable wardrobe because they can be worn in various ways and for different occasions.
Investing in versatile clothes means you can create more outfits with fewer items, which is a key principle of sustainable fashion.
Sustainable fashion is all about buying clothes that are versatile, timeless, and made to last.
This T-shirt was made with fair trade cotton, ensuring that the workers who grew and harvested the cotton were paid fairly.
We only source our fabrics from fair trade suppliers who prioritize ethical and sustainable production methods.
The fair trade certification on this handbag means that the artisans who created it were paid fairly for their work and had decent working conditions.
This dress is made using low-impact dyeing methods, which use less water and energy than traditional dyeing processes.
The vibrant colors of this shirt were achieved through low-impact dyeing, which also ensures the fabric stays soft and comfortable to wear.
The skirt you're wearing was colored using low-impact dyeing, which means it's safe for the environment and your skin.
The minimalist approach to fashion emphasizes quality over quantity and encourages us to invest in versatile pieces that can be worn for years to come.
A minimalist approach to fashion also means being mindful of our consumption habits and only buying what we truly need or love.
The philosophy of minimalism can extend beyond our clothes and into other areas of our lives, such as reducing waste and simplifying our daily routines.
I love investing in seasonless clothing that I can wear year-round, it's a more sustainable approach to fashion.
Seasonless clothing is becoming more popular as people look for options that they can wear all year round.
I always try to incorporate more seasonless clothing into my wardrobe as a way of reducing my environmental impact.
Conscious consumption means being mindful of the environmental and social impacts of our purchases.
Conscious consumption involves thinking about the entire lifecycle of a product, from production to disposal.
Small changes in our daily habits, like bringing reusable bags and water bottles, can make a big difference in practicing conscious consumption.
The fashion brand prides itself on its commitment to traceability, ensuring that every stage of production is documented and transparent.
Traceability is becoming more important than ever, as consumers demand to know the environmental and social impacts of the clothes they buy.
The fashion industry is still struggling to achieve full traceability, with many brands unable to track the source of their materials or the conditions in which they are produced.
The lack of traceability in the fashion industry has led to numerous scandals, such as the use of slave labor or the dumping of toxic waste into rivers.
Traceability is not just about knowing where your clothes come from, but also about understanding the impact they have on people and the planet.
